page.title: 16ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: Edward VII visited the Keppels at Quidenham Hall. Thomas Fulcher is remembered in the church as he was the priest of Old Buckenham for 64 years, dying in 1888. In the windows near the pulpit is some medieval glass dating from about 1470 which depicts shields of local landowners, St George and East Anglia. This glass is fairly rare as the Puritans abhorred heraldic glass and considered it too gaudy. There is some later glass in the church which is worth noting by C. F. Kempe, who travelled all over the country in the late 19th century. His trademark is a wheatsheaf, which is the 'champion' or 'kempe' of the harvest. The oldest gravestone in the church yard is dated 1652. People had been buried there long before but the graves were unmarked.
